title: Teaching
text:
Previous Teaching Experience

Louisiana Tech University (2022-2023)
Graduate Teaching Assistant for: - Finance 318: Business Finance - Economics 510: Managerial Economics
- Finance 319: Principles of Finance
Responsibilities included proctoring and grading assignments, leading weekly tutoring sessions for Finance 318 students, and performing data collection and analysis for faculty research projects.

title: Welcome
text: I am working towards my Ph.D.¬†in Agricultural and Applied Economics at Virginia Tech, with an expected graduation in Summer 2027. My research interests focus on commodity markets, agrifood value chains, and the intersection of theory-driven and algorithmic approaches to forecasting and inference. I combine traditional econometric methods with machine learning techniques to develop more accurate and interpretable models for understanding agricultural market dynamics.

title: Welcome
text: I am working towards my Ph.D.¬†in Agricultural and Applied Economics at Virginia Tech, with an expected graduation in Summer 2027. My research interests focus on commodity markets, agrifood value chains, and the intersection of theory-driven and algorithmic approaches to forecasting and inference. I combine traditional econometric methods with machine learning techniques to develop more accurate and interpretable models for understanding agricultural market dynamics.

title: Welcome
text:
Research Interests
My research focuses on the intersection of agricultural economics, quantitative methods, and policy analysis. I am particularly interested in:

Commodity Markets: Price discovery, market integration, and volatility spillovers in agricultural futures markets
Agrifood Value Chains: Developing quantitative tools and strategies for risk management along agricultural value chains
Forecasting Methods: Developing and applying advanced time-series econometric models and machine learning algorithms to improve prediction accuracy
Macroeconomic Transmission: Understanding how macroeconomic shocks propagate through food systems and affect agricultural markets

title: Welcome
text:
Current Research
My current research develops novel methods for forecasting food price inflation by integrating high-dimensional macroeconomic data with machine learning approaches. This work aims to improve upon traditional forecasting models by capturing complex, nonlinear relationships while maintaining economic interpretability. I‚Äôm particularly interested in how macroeconomic shocks transmit through food systems and how advanced statistical methods can better predict these dynamics during periods of economic volatility.

title: Food Inflation Dashboard
text:
This page will feature an interactive dashboard displaying:

Real-time food price inflation forecasts
Comparison of various model predictions
Interactive visualizations of macroeconomic drivers
Historical forecast accuracy metrics
Time-varying parameter evolution

The dashboard is currently under development and will be deployed soon.



Monthly forecast updates with automated data pulls
Interactive charts showing inflation trends across food categories
Model performance metrics comparing different forecasting approaches
Downloadable forecast data for research and analysis

Check back soon for the live dashboard!
